oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oospore biology in the Nordic countries: Facts, hypothesis and anecdotes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hannukkala, Asko
Andersson, Björn
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The migration of the A2 mating type of Phytophthora infestans and new blight populations into Europe in 1980s raised serious questions: Are oospores formed in the potato crop? Can they survive in soil? Can they infect following potato crops? What is their impact on late blight epidemiology?
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Hannukkala, Asko and Andersson, Björn (2006) Oospore biology in the Nordic countries: Facts, hypothesis and anecdotes. In: NJF Report, Nordic Association of Agricultural Scientists, 2 (9), p. 17.
